required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment Patterns in Castrate Resistant Prostate Cancer Patients With Bone Metastases in a Medicare Population
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment Patterns in Castrate Resistant Prostate Cancer Patients With Bone Metastases

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the study is to provide a detailed description of treatments for CRPC (Castrate Resistant Prostate Cancer) patients with bone metastases and the resource utilization and costs associated with that diagnosis and subsequent treatments.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of skeletal related events (SREs) of the mCRPC patients
Type of skeletal related events (SREs) of the mCRPC patients
Number of patients with mCRPC with bone metastases
Type of treatments associated with mCRPC
primary_outcome.description: Treatments could include chemotherapy or bone radiation
Distribution of treatments for mCRPC patients will be tracked by the type of provider (oncologist, versus urologist, versus radiation oncologist, etc)

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical and demographic characteristics of the mCRPC patients
primary_outcome.description: Gender, age, geographical region and race/ethnicity, Key comorbidities will also be documented using the Deyo-Charlson Comorbidity Index (DCCI); laboratory results for Prostate-Specific Antigen (PSA) and alkaline phosphatase (ALP) testing using laboratory claims; Rx utilization including opioid use

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment patterns of mCRPC patients with bone metastases
Progression of the disease of mCRPC patients

secondary_outcome.measure: All-cause healthcare resource utilization for mCRPC patients
secondary_outcome.description: Using all post-index medical and pharmacy claims, compute the count of physician office visits, outpatient services, inpatient stay, length of inpatient stay, ancillary services, and count of pharmacy claims

secondary_outcome.measure: mCRPC-specific healthcare resource utilization for mCRPC patients
secondary_outcome.description: Healthcare resource utilization will be measured using all post-index medical and pharmacy claims to create counts for physician office visits, outpatient services, inpatient stay, length of inpatient stay, ancillary services and counts of pharmacy claims

secondary_outcome.measure: All-cause healthcare costs for mCRPC patients
secondary_outcome.description: Healthcare costs will be determined using all post-index medical and pharmacy claims. The all-cause total (medical + pharmacy), medical and pharmacy costs will be computed. A family of general linear model analysis will be performed (medical, pharmacy, and total costs)

secondary_outcome.measure: mCRPC-specific healthcare costs for mCRPC patients
secondary_outcome.description: Healthcare costs will be determined using all post-index medical and pharmacy claims where a diagnosis of mCRPC appears in any of the nine diagnosis positions. The mCRPC specific total (Medical + pharmacy), medical and pharmacy costs associated with these claims will be computed.

arm_group.description: Patients with castrated resistant prostate cancer and bone metastases

intervention.description: Therapies used to treat prostate cancer and more specifically castrate resistant prostate cancer inclusively Xofigo (Radium-223 dichloride, BAY88-8223)

study_pop.textblock: Castrated resistant prostate cancer patients with bone metastases

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- First diagnosis for bone metastases for members diagnosed with prostate cancer found in the claims data during the identification period
- Members age ≥ 55 to 89 years at index
- Medicare members with medical and pharmacy coverage; and
- Continuously enrolled during the pre- and post-index periods.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Member with diagnosis of any other cancer (excluding melanoma (ICD-9 172.x) and other metastases (ICD-9 198.x)) before the index date; and
- Members age ≥ 89 years of age at index date
